title: Geoffrey Berman: Trump fires top US prosecutor who refused to quit
description: The president removes Geoffrey Berman from office, a day after he said he was not stepping down.

title: One school's approach to teaching black history
description: This school chooses to teach black history all year round, rather than for just one month.

title: One-fifth of Earth's ocean floor is now mapped
description: This leaves four-fifths - twice the area of Mars - still to be surveyed to a modern standard.

title: Coronavirus: Five reasons why it is so bad in Yemen
description: Five reasons why Yemen could be the worst place for coronavirus in the world.

title: 'Cashpoint aid' and Africa: Who benefits?
description: The UK's new hard-nosed approach to African aid is greeted with cynicism, writes the BBC's Andrew Harding.

title: Last of Us Part II: Is this the most accessible game ever?
description: A hotly-anticipated game release brought tears to some purely because of its options menu.

title: Dad school: How to be a better father
description: Dads in Rwanda are taking classes to learn how to be better fathers and husbands.

title: Reading stabbing: Eyewitness describes park attack
description: An eyewitness describes the stabbing incident he saw unfold in Reading.

title: Paul Whelan: The strange case of the ex-marine jailed for spying in Russia
description: How an ex-US marine ended up with a 16-year prison sentence after Russia accused him of spying.

title: Hamilton to set up commission to increase motorsport diversity
description: Lewis Hamilton announces plans to set up a commission in his name to increase diversity in motorsport.

title: Arsenal loss at Brighton 'unacceptable' says Mikel Arteta
description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says the way his side lost their Premier League game at Brighton is "unacceptable".

title: An audience of dummies and other stories you may have missed
description: Some of the stories you may have missed this week.

title: Mariana Trench: Don Walsh's son repeats historic ocean dive
description: Sixty years after his father did it first, Kelly Walsh dives to the deepest point in Earth's oceans.

title: Ex-F1 driver Zanardi in very serious condition after handbike crash
description: Former Formula 1 driver Alex Zanardi is in a "serious but stable" condition after surgery on a head injury sustained in a handbike accident.

title: Coronavirus: Review of 2m social distancing rule 'to conclude within days'
description: Pubs and restaurants might not survive under current guidance in England, industry leaders warn.

title: Anti-racism rally held despite 'stay away' warning
description: Police, politicians and Glasgow's council had asked members of the public to avoid George Square.

title: Protesters topple statues in US states
description: Hundreds of protesters gathered in several states to topple statues associated with slavery.

title: Police warn over upcoming Black Country 'illegal rave'
description: Police intelligence suggests an illegal lockdown rave is planned in a remote Black Country spot.

title: Beyoncé releases surprise new song, Black Parade, on Juneteenth
description: The new track, released on Juneteenth, calls for "peace and reparation for my people".

title: Ipswich library staff record audiobook for 102-year-old
description: Staff track down a 1927 out-of-print novel for one of their regulars who has fond memories of it.

title: US Attorney Geoffrey Berman denies he is stepping down
description: Geoffrey Berman discovered he was resigning in a press release from the US attorney-general.

title: Galwan Valley: China accuses India of 'deliberate provocation'
description: A spokesman says Indian troops attacked Chinese soldiers but gave no details of Chinese casualties.

title: Vote: Which is the greatest European Championship goal?
description: We have come up with a shortlist of 12 goals - now we want you to tell us which you think is the best in European Championship history.

title: Euros On This Day - 20 June: Wales thrash Russia, Neville penalty pain & quickest goal
description: BBC Sport rounds up the best archive action from 20 June in European Championship history.

title: Greta Thunberg: Climate change 'as urgent' as coronavirus
description: Greta Thunberg says the world needs to treat climate change with similar urgency to Covid-19.

title: The Papers: 'Pubs patrolled', and 'true scale' of Covid deaths
description: How the UK could look post-lockdown features on some of Saturday's front pages.

title: 'Having my identity stolen cost me £10,000'
description: The number of ID thefts in the UK in 2019 rose 18% on the year before to a record high 223,000.

title: The 94-year-old fighting for re-election after 49 years as mayor
description: Fifty years in public office has not dampened André Trigano's desire to be mayor of Pamiers, France.

title: Coronavirus: Traffic levels 'now double the lockdown low'
description: The AA says road use could soon be back to normal but there are calls for pollution to be kept down.
